question: Which of the following is not true about Immediate Payment Service (IMPS)?
option1: To use IMPS, both the account holder and beneficiary needs to have Mobile Money Identifier (MMID).
option2: Internet Banking Account facilitates IMPS to transfer money to any account.
option3: The facility is provided by National Payments Corporation of India through its existing NFS switch.
option4: IMPS offers an instant, 24X7, interbank electronic fund transfer service through mobile phones.
answer: To use IMPS, both the account holder and beneficiary needs to have Mobile Money Identifier (MMID).
explanation: One can choose the IMPS method to transfer money using net banking, mobile banking, ATMs or SMSs.D) â€” As internet banking also facilitates IMPS, so all internet banking account holders can use IMPS to transfer funds.
